      • WaterBasin

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        this programme solves the problem in Twitter interview Link is the problem is here: https://medium.com/@bearsandsharks/i-failed-a-twitter-interview-52062fbb534b#.fzmqj6vup given a vector of heights, these heights form a structure like shown in the following figure. It is raining over the structure. The water in one cell always flows to the neighboring cell of least height if it is not already occupied by water or a block. A sink is a cell with the property that water never flows away from it. All the neighboring cells that drains into a sink are said to form a basin. Observe that the structure is thereby partitioned into basins. Determine the number of unit of water contained in all basins. In the exemple the input for this program is [2, 5, 1, 3, 1, 2, 1, 7, 7, 6] and it should output 17 There are two ways to input the data:
        • From keyboard manually
        • Programme reads data from text file, in this format number_space_number, i.e., 1 2
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • get_input_array

        public static java.util.ArrayList get_input_array()
        Get an input array from user, the input must be a non-negative number
        Returns:
        a List contains all input values

      • solution

        public static int solution(java.util.ArrayList arr)
        calculate the size of the sink The algorithm as following:
        • The array is divided in two parts: left size of of the maximum (Max) element and right side of the Max
        • On left size of Max: find the first maxium number on this size - MaxLeft (excluding the Max)
        • On right size of Max: find the first maxium number on this size - MaxRight (excluding the Max)
        • Calculate the area in between MaxLeft-vs-Max, Max-vs-MaxRight
        • remove the range MaxLeft-vs-Max, Max-vs-MaxRight from the array. Replace by by only one element Max.
        • Remove that range from the array, put the Max value in that position
        • Repeat the step above when there is only 3 elements left (i.e., left-max-right)
        Parameters:
        arr - ArrayList of integer values
        Returns:
        the size of the sink

      • Test

        public static void Test(int[] arr,
                        int result)

        Parameters:
        arr - array of integer
        result - expected result
